body: • An interview with Stephan James, who stars in a new film about the athlete Jesse Owens, Race (‘Being famous didn’t mean anything. Jesse Owens was still black’, 27 May, page 14, G2), said that Owens’ record for the 100m was 9.4 seconds. That was actually his time for the 100-yard dash; he won the 100-metre sprint at the Berlin Olympics in 1936 with a time of 10.3 seconds. • In an article reporting that 40,000 properties in London are owned by offshore companies, an increase of 9% in the past 10 months (Offshore London: secretive firms buying up the capital, 27 May, page 1), we said the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea “includes the wealthy enclaves of Fulham and Knightsbridge”. The former is actually part of the neighbouring borough of Hammersmith and Fulham. • We misnamed the serial killer Aileen Wuornos as Eileen Wournos (Last night’s TV, 26 May, page 21, G2). • Because of an error in a press release from Eurostar, an article about the company’s new Snap fares for train services between London and Paris or Brussels said that the tickets, which cost £25 each way, “can only be booked the week before travel”. In fact they must be booked at least seven days before travel (Cheaper Eurostar fares for flexible travellers, 26 May, page 23).
